Bitcoin Address Observer let you observe any Bitcoin address and shows you if something happens on the observed address. 

When an address is added, the app does a lookup on the current transaction count recorded on the blockchain and stores this locally. This counter is then used to detect any future change. 

Don't forget to tell the app when you noticed the change by reset the local transaction counter to the remote one by long click on the address. 

It uses public API from oxt.me to get latest onchain data. 

Please note, if you want Bitcoin Address Observer to notifiy you on transaction count change on your addresses, you have to enable this feature in preferences.
